turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: COME ON!

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: HELLLLLLLLP!!

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Yeah, maybe.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Get something on that.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Where the hell are we going to go then, Billy Jack!?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: There's a bomb shelter over in Durant, by the IGA, on First. You all know where that is?

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: You don't want the rag to touch the booze, that way you can hold it awhile and ensure it explodes when you throw it.

turns.speaker: PARA
turns.text: You sure? I thought the rag had to touch?

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: I'm sure.

turns.speaker: PARA
turns.text: HELP MEEE!

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: BONSAI!

turns.speaker: PARA
turns.text: I'm in a wheelchair, the truck sounds pretty good.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Amazing you made it this far.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Nothin' will happen to you. You get on my back, hold on tight and we truck out of here together.

turns.speaker: PARA
turns.text: Am I too heavy for you?

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: Don't worry, you'll be like my little papoose.

turns.speaker: BOZO
turns.text: OH JESUS!

turns.speaker: PARA
turns.text: HELLLPPP!

turns.speaker: GOLDIE
turns.text: Well, maybe they migrate?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: As long as it's dark, they're around. They hide, wait for you to drop your guard, and then attack.

turns.speaker: GOLDIE
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Everyone take a role. Let's prepare the guns, ammo and whatever else we can scare up. We also need to help the hurt so we can move them on our ultimate exit outta here.  So, who's going into the basement with me?

turns.speaker: GOLDIE
turns.text: Okay, well... anybody else have an idea?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Is there any other way out of this place? ANYONE?

turns.speaker: GOLDIE
turns.text: Yeah, I'll go.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Ok. Let's see what happens.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Let's move.

turns.speaker: GOLDIE
turns.text: I'm done drinking. That's it. Just Church and grocery stores. Nothin' else.

turns.speaker: GOOD GUY
turns.text: Do we have anything else to defend ourselves with? Anything?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Right. Were going to need some fire power.  Do you have any sort of guns or ammunition here? Anything at all?

turns.speaker: GOOD GUY
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Nothing, just lookin'.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: GOOD GUY
turns.text: She's not very nice, is she?

turns.speaker: GOOD GUY
turns.text: DON'T!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: YOU'LL HIT US!

turns.speaker: GOOD GUY
turns.text: Let's wait it out.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: They'll tear this place down within the hour.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: If you are face to face with her, dive left.

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: And the last one is the...

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Father. The biggest, the strongest...

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Okay, well that's something.

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: So we've got guns, kitchen knives, pipes, fire and sticks.

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: There's a rifle and a shotgun here.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: That's fine.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Hold it!

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: Whoa!

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: Let's go!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Wait God-dammit!

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: If there is only one way out for us, there is only one way in for them.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Make a distraction out front and go for it out the back. There's cars back there, right?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Go! Go!

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: Not without you!!!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Go!!!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Get to your cars!

turns.speaker: ROADIE
turns.text: GO-GO-GO!!

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: Oh my God... What is that?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: That's one piece of four problems.

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: Cody! Cody are you all right? Mommy's coming! Mommy's coming, baby! Don't move! Mommy's coming!

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Stop her!

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: Oh sweetheart! What was I thinking? Mommy is never gonna let you go. Oh Jesus... Never, ever, never let you go.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Let's lock off this room.

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: Shut up! Shut your mouth. You have no idea what is running through me right now. No idea.  I'm ready.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: You know you don't have to do this.

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: I'm fine, I really am.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: I admire your strength.

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: We all have to be strong, right?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: Her name is Charlie.

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: She's still alive, I hope. I wouldn't have made it this far if it weren't for the chance of seeing my little girl again. I need to get to her.

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: I'll do anything to help.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: I know. Thanks. Just don't tell anyone I have a soft side.

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: We should stick together out there.

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: I'd love to.

turns.speaker: TUFFY
turns.text: Did we make it?

turns.speaker: HEROINE
turns.text: I think --

turns.speaker: TROOP LEADER
turns.text: Hey little bear, aren't you going to join the others?

turns.speaker: SICKLY BROWNIE
turns.text: Um, my allergist told me not to engage in physically demanding activities where ragweed or spores might be present, sir.

turns.speaker: TROOP LEADER
turns.text: Do you have a note to corroborate these claims?

turns.speaker: SICKLY BROWNIE
turns.text: Um, well...

turns.speaker: TROOP LEADER
turns.text: Are you lying to me?

turns.speaker: SICKLY BROWNIE
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: TROOP LEADER
turns.text: What did we say about lying?

turns.speaker: SICKLY BROWNIE
turns.text: I'm not lying.

turns.speaker: TROOP LEADER
turns.text: You know that no one likes a liar, right?

turns.speaker: SICKLY BROWNIE
turns.text: I said I'm not lying.

turns.speaker: TROOP LEADER
turns.text: What have you done now, broke the darn thing?

turns.speaker: SICKLY BROWNIE
turns.text: I just hit it like you said.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Well... come on.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: This is a mistake. No. This is a disaster.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Come on, it's just what you need! Let everyone see you. Talk to them, live it up!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But we've been at it since six this morning. At least you could've let me go home and change.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Look, Frances, I didn't want this job. Think I'm crazy? But you begged me: improve your image. So please... lemme try, huh?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You're right. I'm sorry.  Okay, let's go get 'em.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Here, take a few of these. Studio makes 'em in the basement. They keep the fat off.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: So not only am I a troublesome bitch, but I'm fat too?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Come on. They make you feel nice and peppy.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Frances?  Oh no.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Refill my drink, will you, Bob?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What're you doing?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Putting on my armor.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Come on, Frances. Louella Parsons is here. She wants to talk to you, help you out.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Louella... didn't she call me a spoiled little bitch?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Come on, she's an important columnist! What's the matter? I thought you wanted these people to forgive you.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: 'Forgive'...? For What?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I'm sorry... that was an unfortunate choice of words.

turns.speaker: LAWYER
turns.text: And on top of her political activities, now she's got a lawyer. She wants out of her contract, Mr. Bebe. She says she's through with motion pictures.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: I'm sure it wasn't me, it wasn't me...

turns.speaker: LAWYER
turns.text: Excuse me, sir?

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: I don't know who she fucked to get where she is, but I don't think it was me.

turns.speaker: LAWYER
turns.text: Well... you could always dump her, Mr. Bebe. Teach her a lesson. There are a million beautiful girls out there who don't give a damn about politics.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: That's not the point. Frances Farmer has the world by the tit because of this studio, and now she thinks she can waltz off without a thank you. No. No, that young lady has a contract, and she's going to honor it.

turns.speaker: LAWYER
turns.text: Oh. I mean, good.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: I think it's time to take the gloves off.  Get me some reporters.  Particularly Louella Parsons!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Good morning, Mr. Bebe!

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Frances Farmer, contract player, six- month option.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: Okay. Good tits. Can't we show them off a little more?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I guess so, sir.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: Very fine bone structure.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: That's Frances. I'm not the cookbook.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: You see: We've got to change that name.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: I like your looks. You have the classical bone structure of the very great beauties... Garbo, Dietrich --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Thank you --

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: I intend to make a great deal of money off you.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: Since we have you on a seven year contract, I'm planning long-range. I'm going to loan you out to Sam Goldwyn to make a picture called "Come and Get It."

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Really? That's a very good book. It'd make a terrific --

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: Never mind that. I'm concerned about you. Your attitude.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: Society is falling apart, Miss Farmer, and people have to buckle down, do their jobs. You see, I view myself as the Henry Ford of motion picture industry, and I can't have the fellow who puts on the wheels arguing with the man who installs head-lights, now can I?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But I'm concerned with everything, Mr. Bebe.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: No, I'm concerned with everything.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But I'm the one up there on the screen.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: That's right. You're an actress, Miss Farmer and your job is to act.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Look, Mr. Bebe, you can hold me to my contract, but you can't break me. I'm back, and I'm gonna make the best of it.

turns.speaker: BEBE
turns.text: I'd like nothing better.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Hi Frances, got a minute?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Sure, Claire. If you don't mind walking my way.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Well, I suppose I should just say it. It's your clothes.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: My clothes?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Yeah, I mean slacks... and work clothes... and that awful car --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: It's a perfectly good car. It runs.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Yes, but... Really, I hate to sound... it's just that the public expects something different from its stars. People won't take you seriously.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't care if my clothes are taken seriously. Or my car.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You know what I mean.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Uh-huh. You mean what if the public finds out I perspire? And wear slacks. And drive an old jalopy? What if they find out I'm a real person. Oh no! Say it ain't so! Not a real person!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: That's not all, Frances. Mr. Bebe is very concerned about your politics. He hears you've been donating money, speaking at rallies.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yup. Claire... please, please tell Mr. Bebe that if he worried half as much about his scripts as he does about my private life, we'd make a lot better movies.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm sorry, Frances. It's my job, you know?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I know.  'This is a factory and we each have our jobs. The writer writes, the director directs, and the actress...'

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: ...acts. I'll relay your message.

turns.speaker: CLIFFORD
turns.text: Face it! Confess it! You're weak!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm not!

turns.speaker: CLIFFORD
turns.text: You're afraid!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm not!

turns.speaker: CLIFFORD
turns.text: You don't want to show your whole soul -- ugly, mis-shapen, and pitiful -- you don't want to show it --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: God damn it, Clifford, will you shut up! I tell you, I want to give these things! I want to give them to the audience, and I can give them, I will give them, so shut up!

turns.speaker: CLIFFORD
turns.text: Good, good. Give them that.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CLIFFORD
turns.text: Madam...?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CLIFFORD
turns.text: Oh my God! Frances, I'm such a cad. I can't go through with this. My wife is in Europe, but this is her house...  her bedroom. I can't ask you to...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh well. I guess I better leave then.

turns.speaker: CLIFFORD
turns.text: Okay, but come here first.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: CLIFFORD
turns.text: Come here. I want to show you something.

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: The Group is more than a theatre company. It's the embodiment of an ideal. Our approach allows the actor to be an artist in the fullest sense, a creative individual and an instrument of change. You see --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Really, Mr. Clurman, you don't have to sell me.

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: Forgive my indulgence. Seems we always lecture those who are on time for those who are tardy. The point is, Mr. Odets here has written a wonderful play. Most of the roles are cast, but we haven't found our female lead...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Who is she?

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: ...Not only an artist, but an instrument of change. We must look to the world around us, not content to observe, but to take an active hand in redressing its wrongs. We will not stand idly by as Fascist bombs obliterate democracy. We contribute our profits, for if fascism is not stopped in Spain, it will spread across Europe, jeopardizing the struggle of civilized man to survive.  The artist, to be vital, must be a soldier too.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm not afraid of struggle, Clifford.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Hello, Harold.

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: Frances.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Where's Clifford?

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: He's not here.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: I hear you're meeting with the studio lawyers to get out of your contract.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: That's right. I don't want them breathing down my neck while we're in London.

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: Well... well, you see, that's the point. You won't be opening in London.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You don't think I'm good enough?

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: What?! Good Lord no, it's just... It's money. We needed backing and... well, we found it.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: An actress.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: A rich actress.

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: Yes. That's the deal. She plays Lorna.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But... but wait a minute. We're supposed to be different, right? Clifford says... This theatre is supposed to be different! And this play... this play is all about what greed and money do to people!

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: I know, but --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What does Clifford say?

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: Right now we have to be practical.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Does Clifford even know?  You didn't tell him, did you?  I'm gonna tell him. Where is he?

turns.speaker: CLURMAN
turns.text: He knows, Frances.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Hey, where's the fire, sister?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: In my eyes, officer.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Cool off, beautiful. Didn't you see the sign says "Dimout Zone?"  There's a war on, you know?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Come on. You're seriously trying to tell me the Japs can't find Los Angeles without my headlights?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: I didn't make the law, lady. I just enforce it.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Get your clothes on.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You have no right! You have no fucking right, you bastards! Get the hell out of here --

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Get your clothes on, lady --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: GET OUT!

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: You're under arrest.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: You learn your lines?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Sort of.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: There've been some calls.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Well... about half an hour ago that woman from the talent department called, what's her name?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Claire?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Yeah, Claire. She said she was fired. Too bad, huh?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Fired?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Yeah. She said she delivered your message and that you'd understand.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: There was another call too. From your agent. He says your summer stock deal is all set. So you're going back east, huh?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...Yes.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Without me.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Showdown.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: You weren't going to tell me, were you? Just pack up and leave, is that it?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Dick, we need some time apart --

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Hey, I'm not a complete fool, you know. I can see you're going sour on me, and when I try to do something about it, you turn your back and say it's nothing.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Dick, I can't even breathe here...

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Dwayne! I'm Dwayne now! And you damn well better get used to it!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Dick...

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: I don't suppose it occurred to you that I might want to leave too, that I might want to do theatre? No, 'cause you don't want me along, do you? And the reason has nothing to do with summer stock.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: No. It's all about that night, isn't it?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What night?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: The premiere. I never pressed you about it but god damn it, you're gonna tell me right here and right now what happened and where the hell you were!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You want his name?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh, God! Let's get her out of here tonight, right now! Let's take her with us!

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: The hearing's tomorrow. If she gets out legally, they can't come after her.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Look at her! She'll never pass that sanity test tomorrow...

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'm taking care of that, Harry. Just hold her.  Reserpine. I guarantee you this'll clear her head. She'll wake up feeling smart and sailright through the hearing.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Let's get out of here! I'll lose my job!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Frances, we gotta do it this way. Just remember tomorrow, remember what I told you. What're you gonna tell 'em?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Harry!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I gotta go now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: We're all square now, Harry. Right?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: All square, Doc.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Good. 'Cause I don't want to see you again.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Doctor, it may sound odd, but I believe I've profited from my stay here. It's just what I've needed, to get away like this. But I'm recuperated now. I've had lots of time to think and I've made a few decisions about my life. I'm ready to get on with it.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I know you believe that.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...Don't you?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I'm afraid not. You see, we observe things that you're unaware of: signs, indicators. Your problem cuts very deep, Frances, and we have to get at that deeper stuff so that when you do get out, you'll really feel secure. Does that make sense?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No. Cut this runaround, Doctor. I know better.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Listen to yourself, Frances. The resistance, the anger in your voice.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You... I'm sorry, forgive me. Doctor, tell me honestly, what do I have to do to get out of here?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Be patient, that's all. Take an interest in your treatment and don't dwell on your resentments. You'll be yourself again, I assure you.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...I see.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: We'll talk more about this. I'll see you later.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: One question. If I'm not myself now, just who do you think I am?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Harry? Oh Harry, I knew you'd come. I love you, Harry. I love... Take me home, Harry.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: We'll get you home, Frances.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Thank you, Harry.

turns.speaker: DRAMA TEACHER
turns.text: This is the answer: a subscription drive to "Voice of Action!" First prize is a trip to Moscow! You could visit the art theatre, maybe even meet Stanislavski!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But I'll never win that.

turns.speaker: DRAMA TEACHER
turns.text: Yes, yes, it's all arranged. Everyone's collecting subscriptions in your name. And the best part is: the trip returns you to New York.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: DRAMA TEACHER
turns.text: New York, Frances! Broadway! This is your chance! You belong on the stage!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: EDWARDS
turns.text: ...until finally your mother finds it necessary to commit you to a state mental institution. Were you mentally ill, Frances?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...No, Ralph. I don't believe I ever was sick. But when you're treated like a patient long enough, you're apt to act like one...

turns.speaker: EDWARDS
turns.text: Were you an alcoholic?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EDWARDS
turns.text: Were you a drug addict?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No. Never.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Thank you, Ralph.

turns.speaker: EDWARDS
turns.text: Thank you, Frances. And after the show we're hosting a reception for you and your friends at Hollywood's own Roosevelt Hotel!

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Bye, baby.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: See you next weekend, Dad.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: I'm... I'm really proud of you, Frances.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Thanks, Dad.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: An essay contest... a national contest. That's pretty impressive.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I didn't have much to do with it.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: You wrote it, didn't you?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah, I suppose... Dad, who's Harry York?

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Well, Harry York is a guy who... well, he does a lot of things. Why do you ask?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: He talked to me today. Told me to keep my mouth shut or I'd get everybody in trouble.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Yeah... well... it's possible. Harry York and I both work for Mr. Kaminski right now, and... well... There are lots of folks in this country who never got a square break. That's the way of things, but Mr. Kaminski wants to change it, and when it comes to new ideas, the people in power get nervous.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Is Kaminski a Communist?

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: No, no, no. All he wants to do is see the common man get a little representation.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: He's a socialist, then?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: It's already started, Dad... with me.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: And I can't understand how it can hurt to be honest, but the more I tried to explain --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Dad, please, don't leave early. Just because of Mama --

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Francie, you'll learn that sometimes it's best to stay low and just walk away.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What do I do, Dad?

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: You really want to go?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: And you think it's worth all this?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: If I didn't, I wouldn't put you through it.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: ...Then go.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I love you, Mama.  I love you, Dad.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Be careful, Francie.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...So what do you think?

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: I don't know, honey. Your mother has such big plans for you.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I know that, Dad, but --

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: What you have to understand, Francie, is that she... well... she wanted so much for herself too, and for me, and she never really got to... The only time I ever saw her happy was if her name was in the papers... but she could have been... if times were different she could have been a politician or... I don't know.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But Dad, I'm asking about me. What do you think I should do?

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Well, Francie, sometimes after you get your hands on something you want, it just doesn't look the same. Then you have to be real smart to know if you should hold onto it because it's all you've got... or just let it go. This is the way of things, but I guess you already know that.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Dad... whatever I decide, will it be okay with you?

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Always. Always.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: I'm sorry, I... I don't have a desk in my room, and...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't care, Dad. I love you.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: I love you too, Francie.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Francie, you know I can't do that.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Why? It's such a simple thing. You just let me out and I disappear down a road and you never have to see me again.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: They'll just catch you again, Francie. Besides, your mother will know.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Dad, here! You don't have to stop, just slow down. You can tell Mama I jumped out. She knows that's the kind of thing I'd do. She won't blame you.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: But I gave her my word. Besides, she's still your legal guardian. My hands are tied.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You know where you're taking me. You know what she'll do. Just give me a minute, slow down, give me an instant for once in your life, please?

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Please, Francie...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Daddy!

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Are you... are you hungry?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I pity us, Dad. I pity us both.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: It always amazes me, Lil, how you can whip up a hot, hearty meal out of thin air.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I can thank you for that. It was a hard-earned talent.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Bread?

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: When's the last time you saw a hundred dollars, Ernest Farmer?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: You're poisoning that child's mind.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: I have a right to talk to her. She's my daughter, and she's beginning to understand why I've sacrificed so much in order to achieve...

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: You've sacrificed?! If you'd practice law for decent folk instead of Communists and indigents --

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: They need help, Lil. They pay me back in other ways.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: How? What do they do for you, Kaminski and his friends? They're all anarchists! Traitors!

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: No, Lil. It's just you can't understand their brand of patriotism.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: That's right. I can't understand a man who puts strangers over his family, a man who gives up a good career to become a shiftless inkhorn failure.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: I'm going back to the hotel.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: See you next weekend?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: As usual. Everything as usual, Mr. Farmer. Just give me my due.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: Lillian... I'm more than willing to meet you halfway.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Don't make me sick. I'd sooner drown myself in Puget Sound.

turns.speaker: ERNEST
turns.text: That's a thought, Lil. That sure is a thought.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Kurt!

turns.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
turns.text: Oh, Angela! Go with these trappers! They'll lead you safely down the mountain...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But, Kurt, I...

turns.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
turns.text: No, No arguments. Be my good girl and go. There's a forest, a burning forest, and you know what I have to do!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh, Kurt!

turns.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
turns.text: Oh Angela, my own... Angela!

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: Name?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't believe this! You jerks drag me down here in the middle of the night and you don't even know who the hell I am!

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: Age?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Fifteen.

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: Address?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Just put me down as a avg -- a vagrant vagabond. Come on, this is a joke! Assault and battery? I barely touched that bitch!

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: Occupation?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: I'm really sad it's closing. Now what am I gonna do on Tuesday nights?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You can always come see it in London.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Only if you were in it. Are you?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I wouldn't miss it.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Boy, I'd love to... but I'm going to Hollywood.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Are you an actor?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Hell yes!... well, okay, I'm still in school. But as soon as I graduate... California, here I come!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Are you really serious? About acting?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Why... yes.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Then don't go to Hollywood.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm telling you straight, if you have any serious ambitions, stay clear of the place. It'll crush you.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: You sound as if you hate it.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, I don't hate it.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Aren't you ever going back?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...Not if I can help it.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Gosh! You'll break a lot of hearts.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: They'll mend.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: What about your husband?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Will you be getting back together? When you quit Hollywood, I mean.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Is it true you're getting a divorce? Comrade?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Why, you... you little bastard!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Just one minute...

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: You're wasting your time, lady. Nothing's off the record with me.
